text.last_approved_text: We must defeat the Red Fang in battle before they are able to regain their strength. See it is done.

text.last_approved_text: Beastmen despise the notion of civilisation that man so adores. The land is fit only for reaping - to be despoiled and gorged upon. And so the herd ravages the land, claiming it for themselves.

text.last_approved_text: Beastly Machinations

mission_text.text: Beastly Machinations

text.last_approved_text: The herd is a mighty, unruly clamour of untempered wills, furious temperaments and single-minded hatred of mankind. Unusually, disunity is their greatest strength - the larger the herd, the greater the force they bring to bear.

mission_text.text: The herd is a mighty, unruly clamour of untempered wills, furious temperaments and single-minded hatred of mankind. Unusually, disunity is their greatest strength - the larger the herd, the greater the force they bring to bear.

text.last_approved_text: The Call to War

mission_text.text: The Call to War

text.last_approved_text: The forces of mankind line up before Khazrak, in defiance of his rule and in defence of their pitiful cities. Yet the One-Eye does not fear men and their walls, for he is gifted with the blessings of Ruin.

mission_text.text: The forces of mankind line up before Khazrak, in defiance of his rule and in defence of their pitiful cities. Yet the One-Eye does not fear men and their walls, for he is gifted with the blessings of Ruin.

text.last_approved_text: Eye Opening

mission_text.text: Eye Opening

text.last_approved_text: Before the brayherd, there can be no victory, and there is certainly no quarter. Khazrak's rage at man is unending; capitulation before the herd is simply a self-signed sentence of death.

mission_text.text: Before the brayherd, there can be no victory, and there is certainly no quarter. Khazrak's rage at man is unending; capitulation before the herd is simply a self-signed sentence of death.

text.last_approved_text: The Stench of Oblivion

mission_text.text: The Stench of Oblivion

text.last_approved_text: The world was once riven by Chaos; torn asunder by powers beyond mortal understanding. And so the Beastmen strive to return the world to such a state, one ruined landscape at a time.

mission_text.text: The world was once riven by Chaos; torn asunder by powers beyond mortal understanding. And so the Beastmen strive to return the world to such a state, one ruined landscape at a time.

text.last_approved_text: Riven Land

mission_text.text: Riven Land

text.last_approved_text: Though the herd knows the power and rage of direct assault best of all, there is utility in the machinations of a Bray-Shaman, or the direct, single combat of a towering Gorebull.

mission_text.text: Though the herd knows the power and rage of direct assault best of all, there is utility in the machinations of a Bray-Shaman, or the direct, single combat of a towering Gorebull.

text.last_approved_text: The Call to Dark Deeds

mission_text.text: The Call to Dark Deeds

text.last_approved_text: It is not only man for whom the Beastmen's rage burns. The world itself inflames their ire, and anything that walks upon it - man OR beast - risks a reckoning with the herd, overwrought with unquenchable fury.

mission_text.text: It is not only man for whom the Beastmen's rage burns. The world itself inflames their ire, and anything that walks upon it - man OR beast - risks a reckoning with the herd, overwrought with unquenchable fury.

text.last_approved_text: Man & Beast

mission_text.text: Man & Beast

text.last_approved_text: The herd must grow ever stronger. Worshipping before the herdstone, feasting beneath the forest canopy, the Beastmen grow ever greater in numbers, quenching their hunger for flesh and for war.

mission_text.text: The herd must grow ever stronger. Worshipping before the herdstone, feasting beneath the forest canopy, the Beastmen grow ever greater in numbers, quenching their hunger for flesh and for war.

text.last_approved_text: Summoning Ruin

mission_text.text: Summoning Ruin

text.last_approved_text: The Beastmen are the unholy hybrid of man and beast, born from the rending of the world and the emergence of Chaos. Ruinous corruption seeps from them, pervading every inch of land that they scour.

mission_text.text: The Beastmen are the unholy hybrid of man and beast, born from the rending of the world and the emergence of Chaos. Ruinous corruption seeps from them, pervading every inch of land that they scour.

text.last_approved_text: Heart of Ruin

mission_text.text: Heart of Ruin

text.last_approved_text: Even when the land is cracked and broken, when the world's life seeps from every pore and fissure, still the Beastmen will not stop. They will raid, they will fight, and they will despoil it all.

mission_text.text: Even when the land is cracked and broken, when the world's life seeps from every pore and fissure, still the Beastmen will not stop. They will raid, they will fight, and they will despoil it all.

text.last_approved_text: Seams To Be

mission_text.text: Seams To Be

text.last_approved_text: Praying before great herdstones in the centre of their forest homes, the Beastmen call for the strength to sweep away mankind, performing acts of such heresy that the portends of these dark deeds are felt behind man's 'impenetrable' walls.

mission_text.text: Praying before great herdstones in the centre of their forest homes, the Beastmen call for the strength to sweep away mankind, performing acts of such heresy that the portends of these dark deeds are felt behind man's 'impenetrable' walls.

text.last_approved_text: The Jaws of Victory

mission_text.text: The Jaws of Victory

text.last_approved_text: Mankind knows the threat posed by the Beastmen is real, and ever growing. Only through unity do they foolishly think they can halt this tide of madness. All band together to face the herd, yet it can never be enough.

mission_text.text: Mankind knows the threat posed by the Beastmen is real, and ever growing. Only through unity do they foolishly think they can halt this tide of madness. All band together to face the herd, yet it can never be enough.

text.last_approved_text: Fight! Fight! Fight!

mission_text.text: Fight! Fight! Fight!

text.last_approved_text: Every beast knows that, for their efforts, they will be rewarded by the Dark Gods. Mutations, aberrations and greater powers are bestowed on those who spread their Ruinous desires, and so they gather, fight and destroy.

mission_text.text: Every beast knows that, for their efforts, they will be rewarded by the Dark Gods. Mutations, aberrations and greater powers are bestowed on those who spread their Ruinous desires, and so they gather, fight and destroy.

mission_text.text: The Ever-Rising Herd

text.last_approved_text: Corruption courses through the Beastmen as surely as the blood flows through their veins. It is this Chaotic corruption that drives them forward to greater, darker, and ever more twisted deeds.

mission_text.text: Corruption courses through the Beastmen as surely as the blood flows through their veins. It is this Chaotic corruption that drives them forward to greater, darker, and ever more twisted deeds.

text.last_approved_text: The Tendrils of Ruin

mission_text.text: The Tendrils of Ruin

text.last_approved_text: Everything has its price. Even the Beastmen, who deride 'civilised' notions of society and wealth, must pay one another in kind. Bones, flesh, stolen crops, ash, blood - all are valuable to some beast, somewhere.

mission_text.text: Everything has its price. Even the Beastmen, who deride 'civilised' notions of society and wealth, must pay one another in kind. Bones, flesh, stolen crops, ash, blood - all are valuable to some beast, somewhere.

text.last_approved_text: Roar of the Beast

mission_text.text: Roar of the Beast

text.last_approved_text: At the head of the herd is the Beastlord, a powerful creature whose demonstrations of raw power have ensured his ascension. None dare oppose him, lest they can overpower his savage might.

mission_text.text: At the head of the herd is the Beastlord, a powerful creature whose demonstrations of raw power have ensured his ascension. None dare oppose him, lest they can overpower his savage might.

text.last_approved_text: Head of the Herd

mission_text.text: Head of the Herd

text.last_approved_text: A herd without enemies is a herd without purpose. When resting, they think only of war, when feasting they think only of greater battles. The world is full of enemies to destroy, and the Beastmen WILL destroy them.

mission_text.text: A herd without enemies is a herd without purpose. When resting, they think only of war, when feasting they think only of greater battles. The world is full of enemies to destroy, and the Beastmen WILL destroy them.

text.last_approved_text: Shock & Roar

mission_text.text: Shock & Roar

text.last_approved_text: The Beastmen hate mankind and anything else that dares to get in their way. Their bitterness is unmatched, their hatred unparalleled. Across the Old World, there are none who hate and war as much as the warherds.

mission_text.text: The Beastmen hate mankind and anything else that dares to get in their way. Their bitterness is unmatched, their hatred unparalleled. Across the Old World, there are none who hate and war as much as the warherds.

mission_text.text: Total Roar

text.last_approved_text: The failing world of man will know the touch of Ruin too when the Beastmen destroy their homes and conquer their lands in the name of Chaos. The Uncloven Ones will know the hideous touch of the Dark Gods.

text.last_approved_text: Let the World Fall

mission_text.text: Let the World Fall

text.last_approved_text: At the very end of all things, when Chaos purges the world of its hope and vitality, the Beastmen will know they played their part in its destruction and be proud.

mission_text.text: At the very end of all things, when Chaos purges the world of its hope and vitality, the Beastmen will know they played their part in its destruction and be proud.

mission_text.text: The Death of the World

text.last_approved_text: Great herds are led by great Beastlords; those who can weather the trials and tribulations that the herd suffer. Hatred leading hatred; there is no greater strength.

text.last_approved_text: From afar, the Beastmen watch the cities of man with a baleful gaze, longing to tear apart that which they so detest. And so it comes to pass.

text.last_approved_text: The worshippers of this 'wolf god' desperately attempt to bring order to a world riven by madness, a world deserving of naught but havoc. Bring that havoc to the world. Let fire consume it all.

text.last_approved_text: Beastmen despise the notion of civilisation that man so adores. The land is fit only for reaping - to be despoiled and gorged upon. And so the herd ravages the land, claiming it for themselves.

mission_text.text: Beastmen despise the notion of civilisation that man so adores. The land is fit only for reaping - to be despoiled and gorged upon. And so the herd ravages the land, claiming it for themselves.

text.last_approved_text: What dark and devious machinations do the Bray-Shamans devise? What brutality can the Gorebull wreak? Ahead of the vanguard, in amongst the foe, they demonstrate their terrible abilities and sow the seeds of man's destruction.

mission_text.text: What dark and devious machinations do the Bray-Shamans devise? What brutality can the Gorebull wreak? Ahead of the vanguard, in amongst the foe, they demonstrate their terrible abilities and sow the seeds of man's destruction.

text.last_approved_text: Beastly Machinations

mission_text.text: Beastly Machinations

text.last_approved_text: The herd is a mighty, unruly clamour of untempered wills, furious temperaments and single-minded hatred of mankind. Unusually, disunity is their greatest strength - the larger the herd, the greater the force they bring to bear.

mission_text.text: The herd is a mighty, unruly clamour of untempered wills, furious temperaments and single-minded hatred of mankind. Unusually, disunity is their greatest strength - the larger the herd, the greater the force they bring to bear.

text.last_approved_text: The Call to War

mission_text.text: The Call to War

text.last_approved_text: The Empire of man rises above the world, stone-clad and armoured in ignorance. No stone can be left unmarred, no man left standing. It all must burn, and Morghur must spread this ceaseless fire throughout the world.

mission_text.text: The Empire of man rises above the world, stone-clad and armoured in ignorance. No stone can be left unmarred, no man left standing. It all must burn, and Morghur must spread this ceaseless fire throughout the world.

text.last_approved_text: Riches to Ruins

mission_text.text: Riches to Ruins

text.last_approved_text: The fire must spread throughout the world of man as surely as it would spread through a forest; their brittle bodies are the kindling from which this inferno will propagate, until they are reduced to blackened cinders - no more than a blackened mark on the world.

mission_text.text: The fire must spread throughout the world of man as surely as it would spread through a forest; their brittle bodies are the kindling from which this inferno will propagate, until they are reduced to blackened cinders - no more than a blackened mark on the world.
Ex-Men

text.last_approved_text: The world was once riven by Chaos; torn asunder by powers beyond mortal understanding. And so the Beastmen strive to return the world to such a state, one ruined landscape at a time.

mission_text.text: The world was once riven by Chaos; torn asunder by powers beyond mortal understanding. And so the Beastmen strive to return the world to such a state, one ruined landscape at a time.

text.last_approved_text: Riven Land

mission_text.text: Riven Land

text.last_approved_text: Though the herd knows the power and rage of direct assault best of all, there is utility in the machinations of a Bray-Shaman, or the direct, single combat of a towering Gorebull.

mission_text.text: Though the herd knows the power and rage of direct assault best of all, there is utility in the machinations of a Bray-Shaman, or the direct, single combat of a towering Gorebull.

text.last_approved_text: It is not only man for whom the Beastmen's rage burns. The world itself inflames their ire, and anything that walks upon it - man OR beast - risks a reckoning with the herd, overwrought with unquenchable fury.

mission_text.text: It is not only man for whom the Beastmen's rage burns. The world itself inflames their ire, and anything that walks upon it - man OR beast - risks a reckoning with the herd, overwrought with unquenchable fury.

text.last_approved_text: Man & Beast

mission_text.text: Man & Beast

text.last_approved_text: The herd must grow ever stronger. Worshipping before the herdstone, feasting beneath the forest canopy, the Beastmen grow ever greater in numbers, quenching their hunger for flesh and for war.

mission_text.text: The herd must grow ever stronger. Worshipping before the herdstone, feasting beneath the forest canopy, the Beastmen grow ever greater in numbers, quenching their hunger for flesh and for war.

text.last_approved_text: Summoning Ruin

mission_text.text: Summoning Ruin

text.last_approved_text: Morghur is an agent of change - horrible and relentless change. Wherever he treads, the world shifts and corrupts around him. So it should be; for he is the Shadowgave - he bends the world to his twisted whim.

mission_text.text: Morghur is an agent of change - horrible and relentless change. Wherever he treads, the world shifts and corrupts around him. So it should be; for he is the Shadowgave - he bends the world to his twisted whim.

text.last_approved_text: Dreams of Change

mission_text.text: Dreams of Change

text.last_approved_text: Even when the land is cracked and broken, when the world's life seeps from every pore and fissure, still the Beastmen will not stop. They will raid, they will fight, and they will despoil it all.

mission_text.text: Even when the land is cracked and broken, when the world's life seeps from every pore and fissure, still the Beastmen will not stop. They will raid, they will fight, and they will despoil it all.

text.last_approved_text: Seams To Be

mission_text.text: Seams To Be

text.last_approved_text: Praying before great herdstones in the centre of their forest homes, the Beastmen call for the strength to sweep away mankind, performing acts of such heresy that the portends of these dark deeds are felt behind man's 'impenetrable' walls.

mission_text.text: Praying before great herdstones in the centre of their forest homes, the Beastmen call for the strength to sweep away mankind, performing acts of such heresy that the portends of these dark deeds are felt behind man's 'impenetrable' walls.

text.last_approved_text: The Jaws of Victory

mission_text.text: The Jaws of Victory

text.last_approved_text: Mankind knows the threat posed by the Beastmen is real, and ever growing. Only through unity do they foolishly think they can halt this tide of madness. All band together to face the herd, yet it can never be enough.

mission_text.text: Mankind knows the threat posed by the Beastmen is real, and ever growing. Only through unity do they foolishly think they can halt this tide of madness. All band together to face the herd, yet it can never be enough.

text.last_approved_text: Fight! Fight! Fight!

mission_text.text: Fight! Fight! Fight!

text.last_approved_text: Every beast knows that, for their efforts, they will be rewarded by the Dark Gods. Mutations, aberrations and greater powers are bestowed on those who spread their Ruinous desires, and so they gather, fight and destroy.

mission_text.text: Every beast knows that, for their efforts, they will be rewarded by the Dark Gods. Mutations, aberrations and greater powers are bestowed on those who spread their Ruinous desires, and so they gather, fight and destroy.

text.last_approved_text: The Ever-Rising Herd

mission_text.text: The Ever-Rising Herd

text.last_approved_text: Morghur is not content to change pockets of the world, he must spread his mutations far and wide. No tower shall lie unbroken, nor the fields unwarped. Morghur will stride across this world, and watch it collapse under his horror.

mission_text.text: Morghur is not content to change pockets of the world, he must spread his mutations far and wide. No tower shall lie unbroken, nor the fields unwarped. Morghur will stride across this world, and watch it collapse under his horror.

mission_text.text: A World Reimagined

text.last_approved_text: Everything has its price. Even the Beastmen, who deride 'civilised' notions of society and wealth, must pay one another in kind. Bones, flesh, stolen crops, ash, blood - all are valuable to some beast, somewhere.

mission_text.text: Everything has its price. Even the Beastmen, who deride 'civilised' notions of society and wealth, must pay one another in kind. Bones, flesh, stolen crops, ash, blood - all are valuable to some beast, somewhere.

text.last_approved_text: Roar of the Beast

mission_text.text: Roar of the Beast

text.last_approved_text: At the head of the herd is the Beastlord, a powerful creature whose demonstrations of raw power have ensured his ascension. None dare oppose him, lest they can overpower his savage might.

mission_text.text: At the head of the herd is the Beastlord, a powerful creature whose demonstrations of raw power have ensured his ascension. None dare oppose him, lest they can overpower his savage might.

text.last_approved_text: Head of the Herd

mission_text.text: Head of the Herd

text.last_approved_text: A herd without enemies is a herd without purpose. When resting, they think only of war, when feasting they think only of greater battles. The world is full of enemies to destroy, and the Beastmen WILL destroy them.

mission_text.text: A herd without enemies is a herd without purpose. When resting, they think only of war, when feasting they think only of greater battles. The world is full of enemies to destroy, and the Beastmen WILL destroy them.

mission_text.text: Shock & Roar

text.last_approved_text: The Beastmen hate mankind and anything else that dares to get in their way. Their bitterness is unmatched, their hatred unparalleled. Across the Old World, there are none who hate and war as much as the warherds.

mission_text.text: The Beastmen hate mankind and anything else that dares to get in their way. Their bitterness is unmatched, their hatred unparalleled. Across the Old World, there are none who hate and war as much as the warherds.

mission_text.text: Total Roar

text.last_approved_text: The Master of Skulls wishes to see a world remade in his image; a twisted collection of aberrant howls and unspeakable horrors. To this end, he strikes out across the world of Elves and man and beasts, cutting a dark and terrible swathe through all he touches.

mission_text.text: Shadowgave & Take

text.last_approved_text: At the very end of all things, when Chaos purges the world of its hope and vitality, the Beastmen will know they played their part in its destruction and be proud.

mission_text.text: At the very end of all things, when Chaos purges the world of its hope and vitality, the Beastmen will know they played their part in its destruction and be proud.

mission_text.text: The Death of the World

text.last_approved_text: Great herds are led by great Beastlords; those who can weather the trials and tribulations that the herd suffer. Hatred leading hatred; there is no greater strength.

mission_text.text: Great herds are led by great Beastlords; those who can weather the trials and tribulations that the herd suffer. Hatred leading hatred; there is no greater strength.

text.last_approved_text: The Herd Obeys

mission_text.text: The Herd Obeys

text.last_approved_text: Even when the world goes to rack and ruin, still some will fight in desperate, pitiful hope. They, too, will be washed away in a tide of blood before the Beastmen's calamitous vengeance.

mission_text.text: Even when the world goes to rack and ruin, still some will fight in desperate, pitiful hope. They, too, will be washed away in a tide of blood before the Beastmen's calamitous vengeance.

text.last_approved_text: Ever watchful, the Bray-Shamans coerce and manipulate the Beastlords, telling them what to do, where to go, how to grow. The Bray-Shamans direct their herds, cultivating them like festering buboes.

mission_text.text: Ever watchful, the Bray-Shamans coerce and manipulate the Beastlords, telling them what to do, where to go, how to grow. The Bray-Shamans direct their herds, cultivating them like festering buboes.

mission_text.text: Unseen Masters

text.last_approved_text: The Beastmen will dive into the very earth itself to fight new enemies, and have fought under stone, forest and sky. Those dwelling on the land are nothing before their might - they are powerless before the fury of the herd.

mission_text.text: The Beastmen will dive into the very earth itself to fight new enemies, and have fought under stone, forest and sky. Those dwelling on the land are nothing before their might - they are powerless before the fury of the herd.

text.last_approved_text: The Blood is the Prize

mission_text.text: The Blood is the Prize

text.last_approved_text: Athel Loren is the borderland between Bretonnia and the Empire, possessed of a mystical guile and nuance that leaves both befuddled before it. Yet within, everything moves as it should. The gears of economy must continue to grind.

mission_text.text: Athel Loren is the borderland between Bretonnia and the Empire, possessed of a mystical guile and nuance that leaves both befuddled before it. Yet within, everything moves as it should. The gears of economy must continue to grind.

text.last_approved_text: Riches of the Earth

mission_text.text: Riches of the Earth

text.last_approved_text: Athel Loren provides for those who endeavour to become one with the forest. Such are the Spellsingers; mages of singular power and raw magical energy, drawn from the heart of Athel Loren itself.

mission_text.text: Athel Loren provides for those who endeavour to become one with the forest. Such are the Spellsingers; mages of singular power and raw magical energy, drawn from the heart of Athel Loren itself.

text.last_approved_text: Sing, Sing, Sing

mission_text.text: Sing, Sing, Sing

text.last_approved_text: When Durthu, Eldest of Ancients, strides to war, the forest strides with him. Ancient trees and vengeful spirits awaken to accompany the venerable Treeman to battle, to protect Athel Loren against any and all incursions.

mission_text.text: When Durthu, Eldest of Ancients, strides to war, the forest strides with him. Ancient trees and vengeful spirits awaken to accompany the venerable Treeman to battle, to protect Athel Loren against any and all incursions.

text.last_approved_text: Warriors of Kurnous

mission_text.text: Warriors of Kurnous

text.last_approved_text: The mutated and savage herds of the Beastmen have long been a stain on the forest, and its inhabitants have long undertaken to purge them from the boughs. Yet they return, again and again, to bring havoc to the glades.

mission_text.text: The mutated and savage herds of the Beastmen have long been a stain on the forest, and its inhabitants have long undertaken to purge them from the boughs. Yet they return, again and again, to bring havoc to the glades.

text.last_approved_text: Beastly Boys

mission_text.text: Beastly Boys

text.last_approved_text: What Ariel dreams, the Asrai create. Athel Loren is a mystical place, but an industrious one, where Elves toil under lightless canopies to ever improve themselves, and be ever better than the perfidious outsiders.

mission_text.text: What Ariel dreams, the Asrai create. Athel Loren is a mystical place, but an industrious one, where Elves toil under lightless canopies to ever improve themselves, and be ever better than the perfidious outsiders.

text.last_approved_text: Dreams of the Forest

mission_text.text: Dreams of the Forest

text.last_approved_text: The boundaries of the Athel Loren are ever expanding, pushing against the waystone fence that contains the forest. So too do the Asrai, wishing to expand their influence and push back against interlopers from without.

mission_text.text: The boundaries of the Athel Loren are ever expanding, pushing against the waystone fence that contains the forest. So too do the Asrai, wishing to expand their influence and push back against interlopers from without.

text.last_approved_text: All Along the Watchtowers

mission_text.text: All Along the Watchtowers

text.last_approved_text: Before the Elves came to Athel Loren, it was the Branchwraiths who ruled the forests. Bitter and twisted by ages of spite, they are nevertheless powerful warriors who, though treacherous to the Asrai, nevertheless fight in defence of their homes.

mission_text.text: Before the Elves came to Athel Loren, it was the Branchwraiths who ruled the forests. Bitter and twisted by ages of spite, they are nevertheless powerful warriors who, though treacherous to the Asrai, nevertheless fight in defence of their homes.

text.last_approved_text: I Need a Hero

mission_text.text: I Need a Hero

text.last_approved_text: The Wood Elves permit very few outsiders into the forest, and repulse many more. Greenskins are no exception. Treacherous, thieving reprobates, the Orcs and Goblins of the nearby mountains are detested by the Asrai for their many treasons and general filth.

mission_text.text: The Wood Elves permit very few outsiders into the forest, and repulse many more. Greenskins are no exception. Treacherous, thieving reprobates, the Orcs and Goblins of the nearby mountains are detested by the Asrai for their many treasons and general filth.

text.last_approved_text: Here Comes the Scum

mission_text.text: Here Comes the Scum

text.last_approved_text: The spirits and wraiths of Athel Loren draw great strength from the forest itself, and focus that power into the destruction of its enemies. When the forest unites, none can stand against it.

mission_text.text: The spirits and wraiths of Athel Loren draw great strength from the forest itself, and focus that power into the destruction of its enemies. When the forest unites, none can stand against it.

text.last_approved_text: Build a Wall

mission_text.text: Build a Wall

text.last_approved_text: Durthu sees the defence of the forest as his sacred duty - a quest above and beyond all others. To hold Athel Loren against any foe, any would-be danger, he would tear the Old World asunder!

mission_text.text: Durthu sees the defence of the forest as his sacred duty - a quest above and beyond all others. To hold Athel Loren against any foe, any would-be danger, he would tear the Old World asunder!

text.last_approved_text: Branching Questline

mission_text.text: Branching Questline

text.last_approved_text: The Elves are always pushing forward. The Starlight Forge is ever ablaze with the fires of industry. From beneath the canopies emerge new means and methods of making the Asrai ever greater.

mission_text.text: The Elves are always pushing forward. The Starlight Forge is ever ablaze with the fires of industry. From beneath the canopies emerge new means and methods of making the Asrai ever greater.

text.last_approved_text: Forged Anew

text.last_approved_text: The forest of Athel Loren has the means to defend itself. The forest spirits manifest in the bodies of Dryads and Tree Kin, all pledging service to Durthu and their woodland home. With powerful limbs and vengeful souls, these leafy warriors suffer neither man nor beast to breach Athel Loren's gentle glades.

mission_text.text: The forest of Athel Loren has the means to defend itself. The forest spirits manifest in the bodies of Dryads and Tree Kin, all pledging service to Durthu and their woodland home. With powerful limbs and vengeful souls, these leafy warriors suffer neither man nor beast to breach Athel Loren's gentle glades.

text.last_approved_text: Bough To No Man

mission_text.text: Bough To No Man

text.last_approved_text: Those who dwell too long alone with the trees lose something of themselves to the forest. So it is with the Waystalkers; solitary and taciturn hunters - masterful archers consumed, almost entirely, by the will of the forest.

mission_text.text: Those who dwell too long alone with the trees lose something of themselves to the forest. So it is with the Waystalkers; solitary and taciturn hunters - masterful archers consumed, almost entirely, by the will of the forest.

text.last_approved_text: Carry On My Wayward Stalker

mission_text.text: Carry On My Wayward Stalker

text.last_approved_text: The spirits of Athel Loren, if powerful enough, irrevocably merge themselves with its trees. These 'Treemen' are caring and beloved by all Athel Loren, yet strike out with savagery at those who would harm the forest.

mission_text.text: The spirits of Athel Loren, if powerful enough, irrevocably merge themselves with its trees. These 'Treemen' are caring and beloved by all Athel Loren, yet strike out with savagery at those who would harm the forest.

mission_text.text: Twas Beauties Killed the Beasts

text.last_approved_text: When Athel Loren is threatened both its spiritual and physical inhabitants rise up in its defence. An army falls, like countless leaves from countless trees, upon those who would threaten the forest.

text.last_approved_text: The forests of Athel Loren are a patchwork of hidden constructions. High above the ground, interlaced amongst the branches, lie great patchwork cities, whilst below ground mighty halls host Elven Lords and Ladies in their government of the woodland realms.

mission_text.text: Fostering Growth

text.last_approved_text: Athel Loren is divided into many realms. Some that languish in eternal sunlight, some in eternal darkness. All are ruled by Glade Lords and the Treemen of the forest; it is they who lead their companions into the fray.

mission_text.text: Eyrie, Man

text.last_approved_text: The mutated and savage herds of the Beastmen have long been a stain on the forest, and its inhabitants have long undertaken to purge them from the boughs. Yet they return, again and again, to bring havoc to the glades.

mission_text.text: The mutated and savage herds of the Beastmen have long been a stain on the forest, and its inhabitants have long undertaken to purge them from the boughs. Yet they return, again and again, to bring havoc to the glades.

text.last_approved_text: Beastly Boys

mission_text.text: Beastly Boys

text.last_approved_text: What Ariel dreams, the Asrai create. Athel Loren is a mystical place, but an industrious one, where Elves toil under lightless canopies to ever improve themselves, and be ever better than the perfidious outsiders.

mission_text.text: What Ariel dreams, the Asrai create. Athel Loren is a mystical place, but an industrious one, where Elves toil under lightless canopies to ever improve themselves, and be ever better than the perfidious outsiders.

text.last_approved_text: Dreams of the Forest

mission_text.text: Dreams of the Forest

text.last_approved_text: The boundaries of the Athel Loren are ever expanding, pushing against the waystone fence that contains the forest. So too do the Asrai, wishing to expand their influence and push back against interlopers from without.

mission_text.text: The boundaries of the Athel Loren are ever expanding, pushing against the waystone fence that contains the forest. So too do the Asrai, wishing to expand their influence and push back against interlopers from without.

text.last_approved_text: All Along the Watchtowers

mission_text.text: All Along the Watchtowers

text.last_approved_text: Before the Elves came to Athel Loren, it was the Branchwraiths who ruled the forests. Bitter and twisted by ages of spite, they are nevertheless powerful warriors who, though treacherous to the Asrai, nevertheless fight in defence of their homes.

mission_text.text: Before the Elves came to Athel Loren, it was the Branchwraiths who ruled the forests. Bitter and twisted by ages of spite, they are nevertheless powerful warriors who, though treacherous to the Asrai, nevertheless fight in defence of their homes.

text.last_approved_text: I Need a Hero

mission_text.text: I Need a Hero

text.last_approved_text: The Wood Elves permit very few outsiders into the forest, and repulse many more. Greenskins are no exception. Treacherous, thieving reprobates, the Orcs and Goblins of the nearby mountains are detested by the Asrai for their many treasons and general filth.

mission_text.text: The Wood Elves permit very few outsiders into the forest, and repulse many more. Greenskins are no exception. Treacherous, thieving reprobates, the Orcs and Goblins of the nearby mountains are detested by the Asrai for their many treasons and general filth.

text.last_approved_text: Here Comes the Scum

mission_text.text: Here Comes the Scum

text.last_approved_text: The Asrai are renowned for their fighting prowess, particularly their skills with bow and arrow. The archers of Athel Loren can fire farther and hit harder than any other race, with accuracy that defies belief.

mission_text.text: The Asrai are renowned for their fighting prowess, particularly their skills with bow and arrow. The archers of Athel Loren can fire farther and hit harder than any other race, with accuracy that defies belief.

text.last_approved_text: Bowyer? I Hardly Know Her!

mission_text.text: Bowyer? I Hardly Know Her!

text.last_approved_text: Much like the Knights of Bretonnia, Orion and his retinue are drawn to the scent of adventure. Be it the Wild Hunt or a war on invaders, the King in the Woods lives for the thrill of the quest and the joy of battle.

mission_text.text: Much like the Knights of Bretonnia, Orion and his retinue are drawn to the scent of adventure. Be it the Wild Hunt or a war on invaders, the King in the Woods lives for the thrill of the quest and the joy of battle.

text.last_approved_text: Branching Questline

mission_text.text: Branching Questline

text.last_approved_text: The Elves are always pushing forward. The Starlight Forge is ever ablaze with the fires of industry. From beneath the canopies emerge new means and methods of making the Asrai ever greater.

mission_text.text: The Elves are always pushing forward. The Starlight Forge is ever ablaze with the fires of industry. From beneath the canopies emerge new means and methods of making the Asrai ever greater.

text.last_approved_text: Forged Anew

mission_text.text: Forged Anew

text.last_approved_text: For the forests to be defended, its lookouts must be manned by wise and powerful Asrai. Likewise, Orion must have a powerful retinue to march with him when war comes to the forest, as it most surely will.

mission_text.text: For the forests to be defended, its lookouts must be manned by wise and powerful Asrai. Likewise, Orion must have a powerful retinue to march with him when war comes to the forest, as it most surely will.

text.last_approved_text: Bough To No Man

mission_text.text: Bough To No Man

text.last_approved_text: Those who dwell too long alone with the trees lose something of themselves to the forest. So it is with the Waystalkers; solitary and taciturn hunters - masterful archers consumed, almost entirely, by the will of the forest.

mission_text.text: Those who dwell too long alone with the trees lose something of themselves to the forest. So it is with the Waystalkers; solitary and taciturn hunters - masterful archers consumed, almost entirely, by the will of the forest.

text.last_approved_text: Carry On My Wayward Stalker

mission_text.text: Carry On My Wayward Stalker

text.last_approved_text: The Asrai and the Forest Dragons have a unique relationship; though savage and protective of Athel Loren, they voraciously desire new knowledge. The Elves - somewhat unusually - graciously share their learning in exchange for the Forest Dragons' aid against common foes.

mission_text.text: The Asrai and the Forest Dragons have a unique relationship; though savage and protective of Athel Loren, they voraciously desire new knowledge. The Elves - somewhat unusually - graciously share their learning in exchange for the Forest Dragons' aid against common foes.

text.last_approved_text: Imagine, Dragons!

mission_text.text: Imagine, Dragons!

text.last_approved_text: Both the Elves and Athel Loren's forest spirits are unified in their hatred of the Beastmen. Both would like nothing more than to see their Ruinous blight scoured from the world. To that end, they fight relentlessly to completely erase the menace of the herd.

mission_text.text: Both the Elves and Athel Loren's forest spirits are unified in their hatred of the Beastmen. Both would like nothing more than to see their Ruinous blight scoured from the world. To that end, they fight relentlessly to completely erase the menace of the herd.

text.last_approved_text: Twas Beauties Killed the Beasts

mission_text.text: Twas Beauties Killed the Beasts

text.last_approved_text: When Athel Loren is threatened both its spiritual and physical inhabitants rise up in its defence. An army falls, like countless leaves from countless trees, upon those who would threaten the forest.

mission_text.text: When Athel Loren is threatened both its spiritual and physical inhabitants rise up in its defence. An army falls, like countless leaves from countless trees, upon those who would threaten the forest.

text.last_approved_text: The Fury of the Forest

mission_text.text: The Fury of the Forest

text.last_approved_text: The forests of Athel Loren are a patchwork of hidden constructions. High above the ground, interlaced amongst the branches, lie great patchwork cities, whilst below ground mighty halls host Elven Lords and Ladies in their government of the woodland realms.

mission_text.text: The forests of Athel Loren are a patchwork of hidden constructions. High above the ground, interlaced amongst the branches, lie great patchwork cities, whilst below ground mighty halls host Elven Lords and Ladies in their government of the woodland realms.

text.last_approved_text: Fostering Growth

mission_text.text: Fostering Growth

text.last_approved_text: Athel Loren is divided into many realms. Some that languish in eternal sunlight, some in eternal darkness. All are ruled by Glade Lords and the Treemen of the forest; it is they who lead their companions into the fray.

mission_text.text: Athel Loren is divided into many realms. Some that languish in eternal sunlight, some in eternal darkness. All are ruled by Glade Lords and the Treemen of the forest; it is they who lead their companions into the fray.

text.last_approved_text: The Plot Thickets

mission_text.text: The Plot Thickets

text.last_approved_text: Those who defend the realms of Athel Loren do so with a preternatural power. Waystalkers shadow their targets and eliminate them with ruthless efficiency, whilst Branchwraiths are unmatched in their murderous abilities.

mission_text.text: Those who defend the realms of Athel Loren do so with a preternatural power. Waystalkers shadow their targets and eliminate them with ruthless efficiency, whilst Branchwraiths are unmatched in their murderous abilities.

text.last_approved_text: Safety Firth

mission_text.text: Safety Firth

text.last_approved_text: Athel Loren must never relent in its march of progress. No other race in the world can match the inhabitants of the forest for intelligence, ingenuity and wherewithal. Long may that be so!

mission_text.text: Athel Loren must never relent in its march of progress. No other race in the world can match the inhabitants of the forest for intelligence, ingenuity and wherewithal. Long may that be so!

text.last_approved_text: Asrai Industrious

mission_text.text: Asrai Industrious

text.last_approved_text: The Beastmen rise from their forests and their filth, frothing over with fury at the 'civilisation' of man. They clamour for blood.

mission_text.text: The Beastmen rise from their forests and their filth, frothing over with fury at the 'civilisation' of man. They clamour for blood.

text.last_approved_text: The Seeds of Hate

mission_text.text: The Seeds of Hate

text.last_approved_text: From afar, the Beastmen watch the cities of man with a baleful gaze, longing to tear apart that which they so detest. And so it comes to pass.

mission_text.text: From afar, the Beastmen watch the cities of man with a baleful gaze, longing to tear apart that which they so detest. And so it comes to pass.

text.last_approved_text: Bitterness Grows

mission_text.text: Bitterness Grows

text.last_approved_text: With splintering roars, the great throng of Beastmen descend upon the world of men. With much clamour, and a singular hatred, they charge and do not cease.

mission_text.text: With splintering roars, the great throng of Beastmen descend upon the world of men. With much clamour, and a singular hatred, they charge and do not cease.

text.last_approved_text: Burgeoning Rage

mission_text.text: Burgeoning Rage

text.last_approved_text: Every tower, every gatehouse, every thatched home is an affront to the Beastmen's very essence. With fire, brawn and rage, the unending herds will see it all destroyed.

mission_text.text: Every tower, every gatehouse, every thatched home is an affront to the Beastmen's very essence. With fire, brawn and rage, the unending herds will see it all destroyed.

text.last_approved_text: Flourishing Venom

mission_text.text: Flourishing Venom

text.last_approved_text: The land burns, the seas boil, the world cracks and blooms into destruction. The Beastmen, bloody-handed, see this, and know that it is right.

mission_text.text: The land burns, the seas boil, the world cracks and blooms into destruction. The Beastmen, bloody-handed, see this, and know that it is right.

text.last_approved_text: The Tree of Wrath

mission_text.text: The Tree of Wrath

text.last_approved_text: At the centre of the realms of Athel Loren lies the Oak of Ages, beating heart of the forest and the sacred shrine of the Asrai. From the mighty Oak, life flows into the forest and through the world.

mission_text.text: At the centre of the realms of Athel Loren lies the Oak of Ages, beating heart of the forest and the sacred shrine of the Asrai. From the mighty Oak, life flows into the forest and through the world.

text.last_approved_text: From Small Seeds…

mission_text.text: From Small Seeds…

text.last_approved_text: From the Oak of Ages, Orion is reborn each year. The Oak gives life to the King of the Asrai, and he in turns gives purpose to his Elvish subjects.

mission_text.text: From the Oak of Ages, Orion is reborn each year. The Oak gives life to the King of the Asrai, and he in turns gives purpose to his Elvish subjects.

text.last_approved_text: The Oak of Oaks

mission_text.text: The Oak of Oaks

text.last_approved_text: The Wood Elves believe their fate, and that of Athel Loren, to be intrinsically linked to the Oak of Ages. Many have tried to despoil it, and for eons many have failed. If - gods forbid - the Oak should fall, so too would the forest itself.

mission_text.text: The Wood Elves believe their fate, and that of Athel Loren, to be intrinsically linked to the Oak of Ages. Many have tried to despoil it, and for eons many have failed. If - gods forbid - the Oak should fall, so too would the forest itself.

text.last_approved_text: What Grows Beneath Mighty Boughs

mission_text.text: What Grows Beneath Mighty Boughs

text.last_approved_text: It is said that no artefact forged by the mortals of the world can match the magical power of but a single acorn from the Oak of Ages. When the Winds of Magic blow strong through Athel Loren, the Oak of Ages radiates with an otherworldly power.

mission_text.text: It is said that no artefact forged by the mortals of the world can match the magical power of but a single acorn from the Oak of Ages. When the Winds of Magic blow strong through Athel Loren, the Oak of Ages radiates with an otherworldly power.

mission_text.text: Great Things Grow Greater

text.last_approved_text: Any Dwarfhold worth its foundations must be able to fill its vaults with gold. Debt is for the beardless!

mission_text.text: Any Dwarfhold worth its foundations must be able to fill its vaults with gold. Debt is for the beardless!

text.last_approved_text: Balance the Books

mission_text.text: Balance the Books

text.last_approved_text: The throngs need leading - go forth into the deeps and find a Thane of Royal blood. Find a grim sort to lead the Clansdwarfs to war!

mission_text.text: The throngs need leading - go forth into the deeps and find a Thane of Royal blood. Find a grim sort to lead the Clansdwarfs to war!

text.last_approved_text: A Grim Sort

mission_text.text: A Grim Sort

text.last_approved_text: During the Golden Age, many wonders of the Old World were Dwarf-built and hidden under the mountains. Let the Dwarfs bring about such an age again.

mission_text.text: During the Golden Age, many wonders of the Old World were Dwarf-built and hidden under the mountains. Let the Dwarfs bring about such an age again.

text.last_approved_text: The Restoration

mission_text.text: The Restoration

text.last_approved_text: The Dwarfs do not forgive or forget very easily, but it is time to strike some grudges from the Dammaz Kron, if only to make room for more.

mission_text.text: The Dwarfs do not forgive or forget very easily, but it is time to strike some grudges from the Dammaz Kron, if only to make room for more.

text.last_approved_text: The Ledger is Full

mission_text.text: The Ledger is Full

text.last_approved_text: Some of the younger generation of Dwarf Engineers are beginning to research and 'innovate'. This doesn't sit well with the traditionalists in the Engineers' Guild, but the High King needs such inquisitive minds in the wars ahead.

mission_text.text: Some of the younger generation of Dwarf Engineers are beginning to research and 'innovate'. This doesn't sit well with the traditionalists in the Engineers' Guild, but the High King needs such inquisitive minds in the wars ahead.

text.last_approved_text: Grumbling in the Engineers' Guild

mission_text.text: Grumbling in the Engineers' Guild

text.last_approved_text: With the High King's tacit permission, the innovators faction within the Engineers' Guild are starting to actually invent things! The traditionalists are in uproar, but the Age of Reckoning will be won in part with new methods, not stagnation!

mission_text.text: With the High King's tacit permission, the innovators faction within the Engineers' Guild are starting to actually invent things! The traditionalists are in uproar, but the Age of Reckoning will be won in part with new methods, not stagnation!

text.last_approved_text: Uproar in the Engineers' Guild

mission_text.text: Uproar in the Engineers' Guild

text.last_approved_text: A sad indictment of the Karaz Ankor is that many a Dwarfhold's Sacred Forge remains unlit, the holy fires burning low or extinguished altogether. It is time they grew bright once more, with a Runesmith hammering at the hearth.

mission_text.text: A sad indictment of the Karaz Ankor is that many a Dwarfhold's Sacred Forge remains unlit, the holy fires burning low or extinguished altogether. It is time they grew bright once more, with a Runesmith hammering at the hearth.

text.last_approved_text: Light the Sacred Forges

mission_text.text: Light the Sacred Forges

text.last_approved_text: There is no definitive rule that marks out the Greatholds from the Dwarfholds. It could be argued that it's the Clansfolk that inhabit the Holds, or the great monuments and halls. Whatever the definition, more Greatholds can only make the Karaz Ankor grow in power.

mission_text.text: There is no definitive rule that marks out the Greatholds from the Dwarfholds. It could be argued that it's the Clansfolk that inhabit the Holds, or the great monuments and halls. Whatever the definition, more Greatholds can only make the Karaz Ankor grow in power.

text.last_approved_text: Dwarfhold to Greathold

mission_text.text: Dwarfhold to Greathold

text.last_approved_text: Each grudge against the Dwarfs is a link in a chain that weighs the whole of the Karaz Ankor low. Thorgrim and his kin must break those chains, and set Dwarfen-folk free!

mission_text.text: Each grudge against the Dwarfs is a link in a chain that weighs the whole of the Karaz Ankor low. Thorgrim and his kin must break those chains, and set Dwarfen-folk free!

text.last_approved_text: Grudgebreaker

mission_text.text: Grudgebreaker

text.last_approved_text: Dwarfs put great stock in the telling of tales, be they sung or recounted in verse. Our Lords need to become like warriors of myth by forging their own legends. For in doing so the Dwarf folk will follow them into the End Times and beyond!

mission_text.text: Dwarfs put great stock in the telling of tales, be they sung or recounted in verse. Our Lords need to become like warriors of myth by forging their own legends. For in doing so the Dwarf folk will follow them into the End Times and beyond!

text.last_approved_text: Storied Warrior

mission_text.text: Storied Warrior

text.last_approved_text: Even the traditionalists of the Engineers' Guild have been won over by this new outlook of improving and iterating on the concepts of the older generations. Continue the engineering renaissance!

mission_text.text: Even the traditionalists of the Engineers' Guild have been won over by this new outlook of improving and iterating on the concepts of the older generations. Continue the engineering renaissance!

text.last_approved_text: Out with Tradition

mission_text.text: Out with Tradition

text.last_approved_text: Nothing fills Dwarfish hearts than seeing brave, bearded warriors with axes in hand, march out to war. A mighty throng is an army that any foe will dread to face!

mission_text.text: Nothing fills Dwarfish hearts than seeing brave, bearded warriors with axes in hand, march out to war. A mighty throng is an army that any foe will dread to face!

text.last_approved_text: A Mighty Throng

mission_text.text: A Mighty Throng

text.last_approved_text: Karaz-a-Karak is the greatest Hold and capital of the Karaz Ankor and seat of the High King since the time before time. Could another Dwarfhold one day rival Everpeak itself? Doubtful.

mission_text.text: Karaz-a-Karak is the greatest Hold and capital of the Karaz Ankor and seat of the High King since the time before time. Could another Dwarfhold one day rival Everpeak itself? Doubtful.

text.last_approved_text: For Everpeak

mission_text.text: For Everpeak

text.last_approved_text: So long as the Dammaz Kron remains filled with the wrongs done to them, the Dwarfs can never put down their axes. No Dwarf can rest as long as there are grudges outstanding!

mission_text.text: So long as the Dammaz Kron remains filled with the wrongs done to them, the Dwarfs can never put down their axes. No Dwarf can rest as long as there are grudges outstanding!

text.last_approved_text: Grudgetamer

mission_text.text: Grudgetamer

text.last_approved_text: To Valaya's sorrow, the Dwarf race is in decline; the older folk outnumber the younger beardlings by some margin. Each Dwarf death is a blow to the entire Dwarfen people; Belegar must ensure he wins battles but convincingly - slaying his foes and keeping his kin alive!

mission_text.text: To Valaya's sorrow, the Dwarf race is in decline; the older folk outnumber the younger beardlings by some margin. Each Dwarf death is a blow to the entire Dwarfen people; Belegar must ensure he wins battles but convincingly - slaying his foes and keeping his kin alive!

text.last_approved_text: Every Dwarf Matters

mission_text.text: Every Dwarf Matters

text.last_approved_text: In the Golden Age, Dwarf throngs comprising thousands of beards would regularly march between Holds, scattering Beastmen and Greenskins alike. While such a sight is much rarer these days, it is surely one to make even the most obstinate Rik proud.

mission_text.text: In the Golden Age, Dwarf throngs comprising thousands of beards would regularly march between Holds, scattering Beastmen and Greenskins alike. While such a sight is much rarer these days, it is surely one to make even the most obstinate Rik proud.

text.last_approved_text: The Throngs of Old

mission_text.text: The Throngs of Old

text.last_approved_text: The Dwarfs know a righteous cause when they see one, and Belegar's quest to reclaim the Eight Peaks is one they all wish to see succeed. The High King has opened his coffers to the Ironhammer, and so too do all Dwarfs, that his throne might be reclaimed for the Karaz Ankor!

mission_text.text: The Dwarfs know a righteous cause when they see one, and Belegar's quest to reclaim the Eight Peaks is one they all wish to see succeed. The High King has opened his coffers to the Ironhammer, and so too do all Dwarfs, that his throne might be reclaimed for the Karaz Ankor!

text.last_approved_text: The Tithes That Bind

mission_text.text: The Tithes That Bind

text.last_approved_text: The Royal Dwarf Clans, including Clan Angrund, are full of gifted Thanes and Riks, ready to take control of the many Dwarf throngs for war. Such Lords must be empowered so they are ready to lead, even as the urks approach their doors.

mission_text.text: The Royal Dwarf Clans, including Clan Angrund, are full of gifted Thanes and Riks, ready to take control of the many Dwarf throngs for war. Such Lords must be empowered so they are ready to lead, even as the urks approach their doors.

text.last_approved_text: A House of Clan Lords

mission_text.text: A House of Clan Lords

text.last_approved_text: The Age of Reckoning is upon the Dwarfs, and many heroes will be forged, their sagas to be sung in drinking halls for the rest of time. Such heroes should be found and raised to greatness, for they can only aid the cause.

mission_text.text: The Age of Reckoning is upon the Dwarfs, and many heroes will be forged, their sagas to be sung in drinking halls for the rest of time. Such heroes should be found and raised to greatness, for they can only aid the cause.

text.last_approved_text: Forge of Heroes

mission_text.text: Forge of Heroes

text.last_approved_text: Despite claims from the Empire and the stubbornness of the traditionalists, Dwarfs are the most technically-able race. A High King who does not furnish its greatest minds and inventors to leverage such gifts is as ignorant as nobles from other races.

mission_text.text: Despite claims from the Empire and the stubbornness of the traditionalists, Dwarfs are the most technically-able race. A High King who does not furnish its greatest minds and inventors to leverage such gifts is as ignorant as nobles from other races.

text.last_approved_text: Eureka!

mission_text.text: Eureka!

text.last_approved_text: Not since the War of the Beard… since when the Ancestor gods walked among the mountain folk… has an army as grand marched forth. The Age of Reckoning is now, the Dammaz Kron wiped clean!

mission_text.text: Not since the War of the Beard… since when the Ancestor gods walked among the mountain folk… has an army as grand marched forth. The Age of Reckoning is now, the Dammaz Kron wiped clean!

text.last_approved_text: A Throng of Legend

mission_text.text: A Throng of Legend

text.last_approved_text: As final victory, for good or ill, draws near, Belegar Ironhammer's influence should be as unyielding as Dwarfen steel. Control of powerful Institutions and Guilds, as well as his own Clan, will give the Ironhammer an edge that will keep all grumblers in line.

mission_text.text: As final victory, for good or ill, draws near, Belegar Ironhammer's influence should be as unyielding as Dwarfen steel. Control of powerful Institutions and Guilds, as well as his own Clan, will give the Ironhammer an edge that will keep all grumblers in line.

text.last_approved_text: King of the Eight Peaks

mission_text.text: King of the Eight Peaks

text.last_approved_text: The final battle is upon the Dwarfs - the great war of vengeance that will see all other races bow before their might. Yet Belegar Ironhammer cannot do all things alone - he must ensure his closest allies, and those Dwarfs who have supported him thus far, are at their most powerful.

mission_text.text: The final battle is upon the Dwarfs - the great war of vengeance that will see all other races bow before their might. Yet Belegar Ironhammer cannot do all things alone - he must ensure his closest allies, and those Dwarfs who have supported him thus far, are at their most powerful.

text.last_approved_text: The War of Vengeance

mission_text.text: The War of Vengeance

text.last_approved_text: It is a time of heroes - an age not seen since Grimnir led great Dwarf warriors into battle. It is time for Belegar Ironhammer to do the same, to bring about such an era, or make his kin believe it so. A great Dwarf Lord should empower such heroes - raise them to greatness!

mission_text.text: It is a time of heroes - an age not seen since Grimnir led great Dwarf warriors into battle. It is time for Belegar Ironhammer to do the same, to bring about such an era, or make his kin believe it so. A great Dwarf Lord should empower such heroes - raise them to greatness!

text.last_approved_text: Time of Heroes

mission_text.text: Time of Heroes

text.last_approved_text: The Age of Reckoning is now. From his reclaimed throne, Belegar Ironhammer needs every ounce of his strength to aid the restoration of the Karaz Ankor. This includes technologies both ancient and new - sweep the traditions of stagnation away, bring innovation to its zenith!

mission_text.text: The Age of Reckoning is now. From his reclaimed throne, Belegar Ironhammer needs every ounce of his strength to aid the restoration of the Karaz Ankor. This includes technologies both ancient and new - sweep the traditions of stagnation away, bring innovation to its zenith!

text.last_approved_text: An Age of Invention

mission_text.text: An Age of Invention

text.last_approved_text: Bring bloodshed and misery to those that stand against the Greenskins. Skarsnik has conspired long and hard to achieve victory, and he will have it by any means necessary. Any means. Gottit, you git? Good.

text.last_approved_text: The Angrund Clan is beset by tribulation. Far from their rightful home, and with little of their former power intact, its Dawi nevertheless cling to hope. Angrund strength endures in King Belegar; aided by the spirits of his restless, vengeful Ancestors, and supported by allied Clans, he will see the Dwarfs’ glory restored!

mission_text.text: The Angrund Clan is beset by tribulation. Far from their rightful home, and with little of their former power intact, its Dawi nevertheless cling to hope. Angrund strength endures in King Belegar; aided by the spirits of his restless, vengeful Ancestors, and supported by allied Clans, he will see the Dwarfs’ glory restored!

text.last_approved_text: The Reckoning Begins

mission_text.text: The Reckoning Begins

text.last_approved_text: With the Time of Woes a distant memory, the Dwarfs should look to the future and the restoration of the Karaz Ankor. The more territory around and even beyond their traditional mountain homes the Dwarfs can claim, the more the Ancestors will be pleased.

mission_text.text: With the Time of Woes a distant memory, the Dwarfs should look to the future and the restoration of the Karaz Ankor. The more territory around and even beyond their traditional mountain homes the Dwarfs can claim, the more the Ancestors will be pleased.

text.last_approved_text: For the Ancestors

mission_text.text: For the Ancestors

text.last_approved_text: The Dwarf expeditionary forces are a brave and vital element of the Dwarf military - they can roam far and secure Holds in the name of their race's glory. Grudges will be wiped from the Dammaz Kron, and the Dwarfs will once again know their rightful glory!

mission_text.text: The Dwarf expeditionary forces are a brave and vital element of the Dwarf military - they can roam far and secure Holds in the name of their race's glory. Grudges will be wiped from the Dammaz Kron, and the Dwarfs will once again know their rightful glory!

text.last_approved_text: One Dwarfhold at a Time

mission_text.text: One Dwarfhold at a Time

text.last_approved_text: The Angrund Clan will know greatness again; Belegar has declared it and his is a fierce and renowned determination. A Dwarf's oath is his honour, and his words his bond. The regions outside of Dawi control must be reclaimed, and made part of their dominion as soon as possible.

mission_text.text: The Angrund Clan will know greatness again; Belegar has declared it and his is a fierce and renowned determination. A Dwarf's oath is his honour, and his words his bond. The regions outside of Dawi control must be reclaimed, and made part of their dominion as soon as possible.

text.last_approved_text: Ironhammer's Oath

mission_text.text: Ironhammer's Oath

text.last_approved_text: Not since Valaya and Grungni strode the mountains have the Dawi been in such a positon. A few more realms taken will see the Karaz Ankor restored to its rightful stature - an empire ruled by those who have committed their all to see it restored, enduring as the mountains themselves. One last push, brave Dawi, one final push...

mission_text.text: Not since Valaya and Grungni strode the mountains have the Dawi been in such a positon. A few more realms taken will see the Karaz Ankor restored to its rightful stature - an empire ruled by those who have committed their all to see it restored, enduring as the mountains themselves. One last push, brave Dawi, one final push...

text.last_approved_text: My Lord, the Dukes of Bretonnia have resided under a chivalrous code for many years. Honour this tradition, build upon the great foundations of Gilles le Breton, and lead the Knightly Orders forward, to glory!

text.last_approved_text: Our lands prosper under your chivalrous rule, yet evil still breeds in every corner. Many look to destroy Bretonnia, and their power grows as quickly as our own. Stave off their advances and unite the banners of Bretonnia with your chivalric actions!

mission_text.text: A Throng of Legend

text.last_approved_text: As victory for good or not draws close, the High King's influence should be as unyielding as Dwarfen steel. Owning powerful Institutions and Guilds, instead of the Clans, gives Thorgrim an edge that will keep all grumblers in line.

mission_text.text: As victory for good or not draws close, the High King's influence should be as unyielding as Dwarfen steel. Owning powerful Institutions and Guilds, instead of the Clans, gives Thorgrim an edge that will keep all grumblers in line.

text.last_approved_text: Highest King

mission_text.text: Highest King

text.last_approved_text: The final battle is upon the Dwarfs - the great war of vengeance that will see all other races bow before their might. But the High King cannot do this alone, he must ensure his closest allies are at their most powerful.

mission_text.text: The final battle is upon the Dwarfs - the great war of vengeance that will see all other races bow before their might. But the High King cannot do this alone, he must ensure his closest allies are at their most powerful.

text.last_approved_text: The War of Vengeance

mission_text.text: The War of Vengeance

text.last_approved_text: It is a time of heroes, an age not seen since Grimnir led great warriors in battle. Grudgebearer must bring about such an era, or make his kin believe it is so. The High King should empower such heroes - raise them to greatness!

mission_text.text: It is a time of heroes, an age not seen since Grimnir led great warriors in battle. Grudgebearer must bring about such an era, or make his kin believe it is so. The High King should empower such heroes - raise them to greatness!

text.last_approved_text: Time of Heroes

mission_text.text: Time of Heroes

text.last_approved_text: The Age of Reckoning is now. The High King needs every tool to bring the Karaz Ankor to beyond its former glory. This includes technologies ancient and new; sweep the traditions of stagnation away, bring innovation to its zenith!

mission_text.text: The Age of Reckoning is now. The High King needs every tool to bring the Karaz Ankor to beyond its former glory. This includes technologies ancient and new; sweep the traditions of stagnation away, bring innovation to its zenith!

text.last_approved_text: An Age of Invention

mission_text.text: An Age of Invention

text.last_approved_text: The Emperor's banner should be seen in battle; after all, it was the backing of the Sigmarite Cult that won Karl Franz the throne, now he must be like the Warrior-King of old!

mission_text.text: The Emperor's banner should be seen in battle; after all, it was the backing of the Sigmarite Cult that won Karl Franz the throne, now he must be like the Warrior-King of old!
Warrior-King

text.last_approved_text: Every Emperor that takes the throne surrounds himself by men whose abilities and loyalty are as strong as the steel they carry. Recruit such a warrior.

mission_text.text: Every Emperor that takes the throne surrounds himself by men whose abilities and loyalty are as strong as the steel they carry. Recruit such a warrior.

text.last_approved_text: Captain's Fable

mission_text.text: Captain's Fable

text.last_approved_text: For the Empire to remain the mightiest of all nations then infrastructure is key. Ulric will be pleased with our Lord's prowess in battle, but there are many other gods to appease and raising great buildings and monuments is one way to achieve that.

mission_text.text: For the Empire to remain the mightiest of all nations then infrastructure is key. Ulric will be pleased with our Lord's prowess in battle, but there are many other gods to appease and raising great buildings and monuments is one way to achieve that.

text.last_approved_text: Build Greatness

mission_text.text: Build Greatness

text.last_approved_text: Assailed by enemies within and without, the Empire is cursed to never know true peace - but Karl Franz was elected Emperor on the promise of quelling the myriad foes, and so his campaign begins in earnest.

mission_text.text: Assailed by enemies within and without, the Empire is cursed to never know true peace - but Karl Franz was elected Emperor on the promise of quelling the myriad foes, and so his campaign begins in earnest.

text.last_approved_text: Election Campaign

mission_text.text: Election Campaign

text.last_approved_text: The Emperor cannot reign over the entire nation without the backing of the Elector Counts, who rule their provinces autonomously. While belligerent Electors may need the threat of steel to come on side, others can be won over with the dove.

mission_text.text: The Emperor cannot reign over the entire nation without the backing of the Elector Counts, who rule their provinces autonomously. While belligerent Electors may need the threat of steel to come on side, others can be won over with the dove.

text.last_approved_text: Shallya's Dove

mission_text.text: Shallya's Dove

text.last_approved_text: In the quest to bring the Empire under Karl Franz's sway, overt diplomacy is not the only method - especially when an Elector or some other regional noble is publically against him. There are more subtle ways to bring a region to heel.

mission_text.text: In the quest to bring the Empire under Karl Franz's sway, overt diplomacy is not the only method - especially when an Elector or some other regional noble is publically against him. There are more subtle ways to bring a region to heel.

text.last_approved_text: Bring to Heel

mission_text.text: Bring to Heel

text.last_approved_text: The Colleges of Magic were founded in the wake of the Great War Against Chaos and the coronation of Magnus the Pious. Never again would the Empire suffer at the magic of others. Now the Empire requires a student from the Colleges to accompany our forces.

mission_text.text: The Colleges of Magic were founded in the wake of the Great War Against Chaos and the coronation of Magnus the Pious. Never again would the Empire suffer at the magic of others. Now the Empire requires a student from the Colleges to accompany our forces.

text.last_approved_text: Apt Pupil

mission_text.text: Apt Pupil

text.last_approved_text: The greatest cities in the Old World reside in the Empire, they are full of danger and wonders, attracting visitors and great minds from across the world. To retain the influx of the great, the cities must prosper.

mission_text.text: The greatest cities in the Old World reside in the Empire, they are full of danger and wonders, attracting visitors and great minds from across the world. To retain the influx of the great, the cities must prosper.

text.last_approved_text: Keep Building

mission_text.text: Keep Building

text.last_approved_text: Our enemies move against us, so we must be decisive both in our own military and strategic goals. Send your subjects and agents on high-priority missions to secure the throne.

mission_text.text: Our enemies move against us, so we must be decisive both in our own military and strategic goals. Send your subjects and agents on high-priority missions to secure the throne.

text.last_approved_text: Mission Control

mission_text.text: Mission Control

text.last_approved_text: A legendary quest fall upon our Lords - rewards and greatness awaits those brave enough to undertake such tasks, for they will be remembered in the annals of history.

mission_text.text: A legendary quest fall upon our Lords - rewards and greatness awaits those brave enough to undertake such tasks, for they will be remembered in the annals of history.

text.last_approved_text: Become Legend

mission_text.text: Become Legend

text.last_approved_text: When Chaos comes or the Greenskins rampage, then borders become irrelevant. Mankind as a race has to come together. This must be achieved by any means necessary.

mission_text.text: When Chaos comes or the Greenskins rampage, then borders become irrelevant. Mankind as a race has to come together. This must be achieved by any means necessary.

text.last_approved_text: Unite or Die

mission_text.text: Unite or Die

text.last_approved_text: It is time our enemies knew what they stood against. An army of disciplined Men of the Empire in all their magnificent panoply will send a strong message through these lands.

mission_text.text: It is time our enemies knew what they stood against. An army of disciplined Men of the Empire in all their magnificent panoply will send a strong message through these lands.

text.last_approved_text: Might Makes Right

mission_text.text: Might Makes Right

text.last_approved_text: The Empire is the greatest nation of the Old World. To retain such a title it needs to dazzle and impress and beguile visitors from all across the realms. Its cities are islands of stature in the vast wilderness of the nation, and the buildings within, jewels.

mission_text.text: The Empire is the greatest nation of the Old World. To retain such a title it needs to dazzle and impress and beguile visitors from all across the realms. Its cities are islands of stature in the vast wilderness of the nation, and the buildings within, jewels.

text.last_approved_text: A Wonder of the Old World

mission_text.text: A Wonder of the Old World

text.last_approved_text: The Emperor's influence spreads far across the lands and beyond our borders. Give loyal servants the authority to enact Franz's will against the enemies of Sigmar, so we can consolidate our power.

mission_text.text: The Emperor's influence spreads far across the lands and beyond our borders. Give loyal servants the authority to enact Franz's will against the enemies of Sigmar, so we can consolidate our power.

text.last_approved_text: Mission Critical

mission_text.text: Mission Critical

text.last_approved_text: There is no stronger message to our foes than dominance on the battlefield. Victories are empty things if we lose too many of our own forces in the engagement. It is time to smash the foe, and have them fleeing before our armoured might.

mission_text.text: There is no stronger message to our foes than dominance on the battlefield. Victories are empty things if we lose too many of our own forces in the engagement. It is time to smash the foe, and have them fleeing before our armoured might.

text.last_approved_text: A Trio of Victories

mission_text.text: A Trio of Victories

text.last_approved_text: A grand muster is called for. The full armoured might of the Empire should be deployed in all its awesome glory. Such a sight will make Ulric and Sigmar weep with joy and their enemies quail with fear.

mission_text.text: A grand muster is called for. The full armoured might of the Empire should be deployed in all its awesome glory. Such a sight will make Ulric and Sigmar weep with joy and their enemies quail with fear.

text.last_approved_text: Armoured Might

mission_text.text: Armoured Might

text.last_approved_text: The Empire is an eclectic place full of many esoteric organisations - religious and otherwise. Such institutions hold a lot of sway, so their blessing is always a boon to any ruling Emperor. Having dominion over their headquarters certainly helps too...

mission_text.text: The Empire is an eclectic place full of many esoteric organisations - religious and otherwise. Such institutions hold a lot of sway, so their blessing is always a boon to any ruling Emperor. Having dominion over their headquarters certainly helps too...

text.last_approved_text: Institutionalised Help

mission_text.text: Institutionalised Help

text.last_approved_text: The greater our most loyal servants become, the tighter the Emperor's rule. Elevate a Lord with power, wealth and influence so that Karl Franz's reign can never be gainsayed by enemies within or without.

mission_text.text: The greater our most loyal servants become, the tighter the Emperor's rule. Elevate a Lord with power, wealth and influence so that Karl Franz's reign can never be gainsayed by enemies within or without.

text.last_approved_text: Lording It

mission_text.text: Lording It

text.last_approved_text: The Emperor has many willing servants; if loyal nobles are elevated to greatness, so, too, should those whose skills and influence lie in other disciplines. Make them great and their faith in Karl Franz will be swollen tenfold.

mission_text.text: The Emperor has many willing servants; if loyal nobles are elevated to greatness, so, too, should those whose skills and influence lie in other disciplines. Make them great and their faith in Karl Franz will be swollen tenfold.

text.last_approved_text: Champions of Franz

mission_text.text: Champions of Franz

text.last_approved_text: Although the Dwarfs will falsely claim otherwise, the Empire is the most technically able race in the world. Mankind willing innovates and is not moribund in tradition or the petty jealousies of the Dwarfen Guilds. We should exploit that.

mission_text.text: Although the Dwarfs will falsely claim otherwise, the Empire is the most technically able race in the world. Mankind willing innovates and is not moribund in tradition or the petty jealousies of the Dwarfen Guilds. We should exploit that.

text.last_approved_text: Invent & Innovate

mission_text.text: Invent & Innovate

text.last_approved_text: Not since the Time of Magnus has there been a greater muster; the armies of the Empire should come together at last, for we stand ready to fight the mightiest of battles. This will be a call to arms like no other!

mission_text.text: Not since the Time of Magnus has there been a greater muster; the armies of the Empire should come together at last, for we stand ready to fight the mightiest of battles. This will be a call to arms like no other!

text.last_approved_text: A Call to Arms

mission_text.text: A Call to Arms

text.last_approved_text: The ultimate threat draws near, those institutions and temples not with us should be brought under our control. The Emperor cares not how this is achieved - offer the branch or the lash - we will have them under Karl Franz's will.

mission_text.text: The ultimate threat draws near, those institutions and temples not with us should be brought under our control. The Emperor cares not how this is achieved - offer the branch or the lash - we will have them under Karl Franz's will.

text.last_approved_text: Emperor's Will

mission_text.text: Emperor's Will

text.last_approved_text: We must raise as many nobles to our circle of influence - make them the greatest they can be, for their loyalty will filter down to the men, girding them for the ultimate conquest.

mission_text.text: We must raise as many nobles to our circle of influence - make them the greatest they can be, for their loyalty will filter down to the men, girding them for the ultimate conquest.

text.last_approved_text: Noble Circle

mission_text.text: Noble Circle
